items.title: Free camera(default camera) pos and quat
fsgdgf
MultiProcessing results in Segmentation fault.
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
When I run multiprocessing, i.e., run multi Mujoco env at the same time, Segmentation fault (core dumped) will be raised.
However, when I run a single task, there is no error.

**To Reproduce**
I can't reproduce the issue in another machine.


**Error Messages**
Segmentation fault

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. Ubuntu 16.04 LTS]
 - Python Version [3.6.10]
 - Mujoco Version  No mujoco env, I directly install mujoco_py
 - mujoco-py version [2.0.2.10 ]

**Environment**
 - output of: `echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH` 
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64:/home/mirror/.mujoco/mujoco200/bin:/usr/lib/nvidia-430:/home/mirror/.mujoco/mujoco200/bin:/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64:/home/mirror/.mujoco/mujoco200/bin:/usr/lib/nvidia-430:/home/mirror/.mujoco/mujoco200/bin
 - output of: `echo $HOME`
/home/mirror
 - output of: `echo $USER` 
mirror

**Additional context**
When I run in a new machine, this error doesn't occur.
No more debug information, just Segmentation fault.

items.title: macOS Catalina: "ld: unknown option: -platform_version" when importing and building mujoco_py
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
When importing mujoco_py, the cymj extension build fails with a clang-10 error. This error also occurs when I do
`brew uninstall gcc && brew install gcc@x` (while x being 6,8,9). Also executing this command didn't help: `conda install -c conda-forge openmp`. Pip and brew have been updated / upgraded before. The gcc-9 compiler line (along those for versions 7 and 8) in the builder.py is active. Applying the sdk folder copy & rename trick from this [issue](https://github.com/openai/mujoco-py/issues/463#issuecomment-545098563) did not help either.

**To Reproduce**
By simply following the installation from the readme on macOS Catalina (10.15.5) with the newest Xcode, CLT and miniconda3.

The extension build to finish without an error.

items.body:
Hi
I installed mujoco-py on windows 10 successfully but when I run _python -c "import mujoco_py"_ I got the following error.

I'm using python 3.8 and conda 4.8

items.title: Depth conversion from OpenGL zbuffer
items.body:
Hi,
I was trying to do 3d reconstruction within MuJoCo. I managed to get rgb and depth images by calling ```sim.render(width=w, height=h, camera_name=camera_name, depth=depth)```
As far as I have learnt about the depth rendering in MuJoCo, it uses OpenGL which convert real depth value into zbuffer. So the returned depth images have all values within [0,1]. 
 [See this link in MuJoCo forum](http://www.mujoco.org/forum/index.php?threads/ds525-or-kinect-camera-for-depth-information-in-mujoco-simulation.3718/#post-4771) 
[see the wikipage about the zbuffering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Z-buffering)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40022305/77697732-67208100-6f7d-11ea-9443-b0a9dad2eb89.png)

The near and far plane is defined by /visual/map/znear and zfar in the XML file. I tested a few senarios with prospective transformation and therefore a non-linear transformation. However, none of the converted real depth value is correct.
Could anyone tell me what is the correct conversion from the zbuffer to real depth value? Thanks a lot.

items.title: libmujoco200.dylib Library Validation error in macOS Catalina
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Fresh install of Mujoco on macOS Catalina fails as libmujoco200.dylib is unable to load due to Library Validation.

**To Reproduce**
brew install gcc
pip install mujoco-py

OR

brew install gcc
git clone https://github.com/openai/mujoco-py.git
pip install -e ~/mujoco-py
python -c "import mujoco_py"

**Expected behavior**
Successfully install and load module.

items.title: MjSim rendering doesn't use GPU
items.body:
I'm running body_interaction.py example file on a remote server. Here's the code after making changes to run in headless mode:

```
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Example of how bodies interact with each other. For a body to be able to
move it needs to have joints. In this example, the "robot" is a red ball
with X and Y slide joints (and a Z slide joint that isn't controlled).
On the floor, there's a cylinder with X and Y slide joints, so it can
be pushed around with the robot. There's also a box without joints. Since
the box doesn't have joints, it's fixed and can't be pushed around.
"""
from mujoco_py import load_model_from_xml, MjSim, MjViewer
import math
import os

MODEL_XML = """
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<mujoco>
    <option timestep="0.005" />
    <worldbody>
        <body name="robot" pos="0 0 1.2">
            <joint axis="1 0 0" damping="0.1" name="slide0" pos="0 0 0" type="slide"/>
            <joint axis="0 1 0" damping="0.1" name="slide1" pos="0 0 0" type="slide"/>
            <joint axis="0 0 1" damping="1" name="slide2" pos="0 0 0" type="slide"/>
            <geom mass="1.0" pos="0 0 0" rgba="1 0 0 1" size="0.15" type="sphere"/>
			<camera euler="0 0 0" fovy="40" name="rgb" pos="0 0 2.5"></camera>
        </body>
        <body mocap="true" name="mocap" pos="0.5 0.5 0.5">
			<geom conaffinity="0" contype="0" pos="0 0 0" rgba="1.0 1.0 1.0 0.5" size="0.1 0.1 0.1" type="box"></geom>
			<geom conaffinity="0" contype="0" pos="0 0 0" rgba="1.0 1.0 1.0 0.5" size="0.2 0.2 0.05" type="box"></geom>
		</body>
        <body name="cylinder" pos="0.1 0.1 0.2">
            <geom mass="1" size="0.15 0.15" type="cylinder"/>
            <joint axis="1 0 0" name="cylinder:slidex" type="slide"/>
            <joint axis="0 1 0" name="cylinder:slidey" type="slide"/>
        </body>
        <body name="box" pos="-0.8 0 0.2">
            <geom mass="0.1" size="0.15 0.15 0.15" type="box"/>
        </body>
        <body name="floor" pos="0 0 0.025">
            <geom condim="3" size="1.0 1.0 0.02" rgba="0 1 0 1" type="box"/>
        </body>
    </worldbody>
    <actuator>
        <motor gear="2000.0" joint="slide0"/>
        <motor gear="2000.0" joint="slide1"/>
    </actuator>
</mujoco>
"""

model = load_model_from_xml(MODEL_XML)
sim = MjSim(model)
img = sim.render(600, 600, device_id=1)
t = 0
while True:
    sim.data.ctrl[0] = math.cos(t / 10.) * 0.01
    sim.data.ctrl[1] = math.sin(t / 10.) * 0.01
    t += 1
    sim.step()
    img = sim.render(600, 600, device_id=1)
    if t > 100 and os.getenv('TESTING') is not None:
        break

```

Even though I specify device_id=1 in sim.render(), the process doesn't use the GPU. Neither does it throw any errors; it just falls back to using the CPU for rendering.
Any suggestions?

Thank you!

items.title: How to load my own robot(urdf) model to mujoco?
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Hi, I am new to mujoco, and I have a robot model which is urdf file. 
At first, I add
< mujoco>
        <compiler meshdir="../meshes/"/ >
< /mujoco >

in the beginning of my urdf file.
And then I use command "./compile model.urdf model.mjb", and also use "./compile model.urdf model.xml" to get mjb and xml file.
But the contents in those files are empty, Nothing is convert.

The contents in xml file are like this:
"
< mujoco model="MuJoCo Model" >
    < compiler angle="radian" meshdir="../meshes/" / >
    < size njmax="500" nconmax="100" / >
    < worldbody / >
< /mujoco >
"
That is all in my xml file.
Has anyone idea how to load urdf robot model to Mujoco? 
Thanks a lot!!!

items.title: PID control for shadow robot like hand does not work
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
The P and PID control does not behave correctly on the prepared model. P control does not behave like position control, and PID behaves in the same wrong way as P control.

**To Reproduce**
Please use prepared repository: https://github.com/Jendker/pid_shadow_robot The setup from repository was created according to the file: https://github.com/openai/mujoco-py/blob/83759c2e20df965dcf727aa79e590a0483aaea0f/mujoco_py/tests/test_pid.py

**Expected behavior**
For the P control we should observe the same behaviour as for position control. The PID should keep the fingers in place and prevent fingers falling due to the gravity influence.

**Error Messages**
None

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubunut 18.04
 - Python Version: 3.6.8
 - Mujoco Version: 2.0
 - mujoco-py version 2.0.2.7

**Environment**
 - output of: `echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH` /home/jedrzej/catkin_ws/devel/lib:/opt/ros/melodic/lib:/home/jedrzej/.mujoco/mujoco200/bin:/home/jedrzej/.mujoco/mujoco200/bin
 - output of: `echo $HOME` /home/jedrzej
 - output of: `echo $USER` jedrzej

**Additional context**
Issue mentioned in https://github.com/openai/mujoco-py/pull/462 @bayesian

Similar stack overflow questions:

items.title: Syntax to load flexible body
items.body:
I am new to mujoco
I have searched about soft body in https://openai.github.io/mujoco-py/build/html/index.html, but still did not found any documentation related to flexible or deformable or soft body.
What is the correct way to load flexible body?
I need to simulate various materials with different stiffness.

Thanks

items.title: ERROR: Shadow framebuffer is not complete, error 0x8cd7
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
When using MjSim.render(), the program returns error

**To Reproduce**
```
>>> import mujoco_py as mj
>>> model = mj.load_model_from_path("./humanoid.xml")
>>> sim = mj.MjSim(model)
>>> sim.render()
ERROR: Shadow framebuffer is not complete, error 0x8cd7

Press Enter to exit ...
```

**Error Messages**
this is the only message I can see
`
ERROR: Shadow framebuffer is not complete, error 0x8cd7
`

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
 - Python Version 3.7.4
 - Mujoco Version 2.0
 - mujoco-py version 2.0.2.5

**Environment**
 - output of: `echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH`
`/home/sjjung/.mujoco/mujoco200/bin:/usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64`
 - output of: `echo $HOME`
`/home/sjjung`
 - output of: `echo $USER`
`sjjung`

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

when I set LD_PRELOAD properly and run

`env.render()`

in openai gym environment, it works smoothly.

Then I `unset LD_PRELOAD` and run

`sim.render` as above, I get error 0x8cd7

I have Titan Xp and nvidia-driver version is 430.40.

I'd love to hear any opinions and suggestions. Thanks in advance!

items.title: Does mujoco-py support manipulating soft bodies?
items.body:
Hi,
I find the mojoco-py framework very cool. Does it support manipulating soft objects like cloth, ropes? As far as I understand, mujoco does support soft object manipulation. Does that support come out-of-the-box for mujoco-py? If not then any ideas on how to do it?
Thanks!

items.title: Access the full joint-space inertia matrix
items.body:
Hi,
I found two issues (#177 and #12 ) back in 2017 talking about how to access the full joint-space inertia matrix as Emo Todorov mentioned  [here](http://www.mujoco.org/forum/index.php?threads/joint-space-inertia-matrix-not-symmetric.3332/).
However, I couldn't find mjlib.py in the new version of mujoco-py. Are there any work around to access the full Joint-space inertia matrix now? Thanks a lot!

items.title: Error while importing mujoco in python 3.6.8: mjmodel.h not found
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
The mjmodel.h file cannot be found while importing the mujoco_py.

But it does exist at the prescribed location

_**ls ~/.mujoco/mujoco200/mujoco200_linux/include
glfw3.h  mjdata.h  mjmodel.h  mjrender.h  mjui.h  mjvisualize.h  mjxmacro.h  mujoco.h  uitools.c  uitools.h**_

on request I have also added the following line to my .bashrc the 
 **_Please add following line to .bashrc:
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/home/aditya/.mujoco/mujoco200/bin_**



**To Reproduce**
Followed the same exact steps as prescribed in the readme file on Github and got the same error.
Also git cloned and tried installing the library with the following command:
**_sudo pip3 install -e . --no-cache_**

The expected behaviour would have been that the the library gets imported.

We expected to find the file here: /Users/maggiefeng/.mujoco/mujoco200**". but I have clearly put the mujoco files in the described folder: I've tried most of the solutions from past posts but haven't succeeded yet with version 1.50.2. When I install Mujoco-py 0.5.7 it can be installed successfully, but for some tasks, 0.5.7 is not enough. FYI - My environment is: MacOS Mojave version 10.14.1 Python 3.5.2 Gym version I am not sure but I tried version 0.9 (but never succeeded overall) Note: in the screenshot below, though I downgraded to python 3.5.2, the installed Mujoco-py 0.5.7 is still in the Python 3.7 library, not sure if this is an issue? Thank you very much for your help!

```python
import os

env = gym.make('Hopper-v2')
```

items.title: ERROR: Shadow framebuffer is not complete, error 0x8cd7
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
When using MjSim.render(), the interpreter crashes.


**To Reproduce**
`python3`
`>>> import mujoco_py as mj`
`>>> model = mj.load_model_from_path("./humanoid.xml")`
`>>> sim = mj.MjSim(model)`
`>>> sim.render()`
`ERROR: Shadow framebuffer is not complete, error 0x8cd7`
``
`Press Enter to exit ...`


**Error Messages**
This is the only message I got:

`ERROR: Shadow framebuffer is not complete, error 0x8cd7`

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux 4.14.109-1-MANJARO, 64-bit
 - Python Version: 3.7.3
 - Mujoco Version 2.0
 - mujoco-py version: 2.0.2.0

**Environment**
 - output of: `echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH`
`/home/jonah/.mujoco/mjpro150/bin/:/home/jonah/.mujoco/mujoco200/bin`

 - output of: `echo $HOME`
`/home/jonah`

 - output of: `echo $USER`
`jonah`

I should mention - I can run the C binaries generated by the makefile in mujoco200/sample. These render correctly as far as I can tell. So I strongly suspect this to be a mujoco_py issue.

items.title: Install mujoco with error "/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lGL" and "gcc" error
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Install MuJoCo via pip3 install -U 'pip3 install -U 'mujoco-py<2.1,>=2.0', I got
    /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lGL
    collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
    error: command 'x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc' failed with exit status 1
I could open the simulation by running ../mjpro150/bin: $ ./simulate ../model/humanoid.xml

**To Reproduce**
1. Download the MuJoCo version 2.0 binaries for Linux or OSX.
2. Unzip the downloaded mujoco200 directory into ~/.mujoco/mujoco200, and place your license key (the mjkey.txt file from your email) at ~/.mujoco/mjkey.txt.
3. export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=~/.mujoco/mujoco200/bin${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}}
export MUJOCO_KEY_PATH=~/.mujoco${MUJOCO_KEY_PATH}
4. pip3 install -U 'mujoco-py<2.1,>=2.0

items.title: Errors while installing into a new conda env
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
While installing into a conda env, there are errors about missing packages, which results in some kind of recovery which eventually correctly installs.
This is confusing to users.

**To Reproduce**
$ conda create -n test -y python=3.6
$ source activate test
$ pip install mujoco-py


**Expected behavior**
Installation of pip packages should not produce user facing errors. dependencies should be installed before mujoco-py is installed.

items.title: Install mujoco with error "/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lGL"
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Install MuJoCo via `pip3 install -U 'mujoco-py<1.50.2,>=1.50.1'`, I got 
```
    /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lGL
    collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
    error: command 'x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc' failed with exit status 1
```
I could open the simulation by running `../mjpro150/bin: $ ./simulate ../model/humanoid.xml`, but the prompt window closes in a very short time.

**To Reproduce**
The mjkey.txt is placed in `/home/libowu/.mujoco/`. Add the environment variable with `$LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/home/libowu/.mujoco/mjpro150/bin`.

items.title: gcc error when installing in an Anaconda environment on OS X
items.body:
I've successfully installed mujoco-py using pip3 and python 3.7.0
However, I need to install it in an Anaconda environment in order to use python 3.6, as required by the [spinningup](https://spinningup.openai.com/en/latest/user/installation.html#mac-os-x) documentation.
After successfully installing the packages for the base requirements of spinningup, I tried installing mujoco-py using `pip install -U pip install -U 'mujoco-py<1.50.2,>=1.50.1'`.

The installation fails when building the pip package for mujoco-py giving the following fatal error:
```
  /usr/local/bin/gcc-8 -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -Wunreachable-code -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O3 -Wall -I/Users/angelolovatto/anaconda3/envs/spinningup/include -arch x86_64 -I/Users/angelolovatto/anaconda3/envs/spinningup/include -arch x86_64 -DONMAC -Imujoco_py -I/private/var/folders/pj/tpywc3yj6y17s6f964hc7d6c0000gn/T/pip-install-r1g67ly0/mujoco-py/mujoco_py -I/Users/angelolovatto/.mujoco/mjpro150/include -I/Users/angelolovatto/anaconda3/envs/spinningup/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/include -I/Users/angelolovatto/anaconda3/envs/spinningup/include/python3.6m -c /private/var/folders/pj/tpywc3yj6y17s6f964hc7d6c0000gn/T/pip-install-r1g67ly0/mujoco-py/mujoco_py/cymj.c -o /private/var/folders/pj/tpywc3yj6y17s6f964hc7d6c0000gn/T/pip-install-r1g67ly0/mujoco-py/mujoco_py/generated/_pyxbld_1.50.1.68_36_macextensionbuilder/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/private/var/folders/pj/tpywc3yj6y17s6f964hc7d6c0000gn/T/pip-install-r1g67ly0/mujoco-py/mujoco_py/cymj.o -fopenmp -w
  In file included from /usr/local/Cellar/gcc/8.2.0/lib/gcc/8/gcc/x86_64-apple-darwin17.7.0/8.2.0/include-fixed/syslimits.h:7,
                   from /usr/local/Cellar/gcc/8.2.0/lib/gcc/8/gcc/x86_64-apple-darwin17.7.0/8.2.0/include-fixed/limits.h:34,
                   from /Users/angelolovatto/anaconda3/envs/spinningup/include/python3.6m/Python.h:11,
                   from /private/var/folders/pj/tpywc3yj6y17s6f964hc7d6c0000gn/T/pip-install-r1g67ly0/mujoco-py/mujoco_py/cymj.c:57:

```

This does not happen using homebrew python, which leads me to believe it's an issue involving the Anaconda environment. The files seem to be all there. 

 - OS: macOS 10.14.1
 - Python: Anaconda python 3.6.7
 - Mujoco Version: 1.50

 - output of `echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH`: empty

items.title: Custom mesh jittering in Mujoco environment in OpenAI gym
items.body: No clue if this belongs here but... I've tried modifying the `FetchPickAndPlace-v1` OpenAI environment to replace the cube with a pair of scissors. Everything works perfectly except for the fact that my custom mesh seems to jitter a few millimeters in and out of the table every few time steps. I've included a picture mid-jitter below: As you can see, the scissors are caught mid-way through the surface of the table. How can I prevent this? All I've done is switch out the code for the cube in `pick_and_place.xml` with the asset related to the scissor mesh. Here's the code of interest: ``` ``` I've tried playing around with the coordinates of the position and geometry but to no avail. Any tips? Replacing `mesh="tool0:scissors"` with `type="box"` gets rid of the problem entirely but I'm back to square one.

items.title: Unable to provide custom XML for mujoco-py
items.body:
Hello,

I hope you're doing well. I'm having an issue loading a custom XML model into `mujoco-py`, and by extension `gym`. I've copied `pick_and_place.xml` and `shared.xml` into a separate directory along with all of their assets and have modified the color of the background to test my setup. Doing the following with the `humanoid.xml` file works well.

```
import mujoco_py
import os
mj_path, _ = mujoco_py.utils.discover_mujoco()
xml_path = os.path.join(mj_path, 'model', 'humanoid.xml')
model = mujoco_py.load_model_from_path(xml_path)
```

Replacing it with my own XML file (using the full file path) as so:
`xml_path = os.path.join(mj_path, 'model', '/Users/cyril/gym-assist/gym_assist/envs/assets/handoff/pick_and_place.xml')`

yields the following error: 
```
Exception: Failed to load XML file: /Users/cyril/gym-assist/gym_assist/envs/assets/handoff/pick_and_place.xml. mj_loadXML error: b"XML Error: Include error: 'XML parse error at line 0, column 0:\nFailed to open file\n'\nElement 'include', line 16, column 9\n"
```

EDIT 1:
Not modifying anything also leads to the error. Going to look deeper into it.

Any ideas?

items.title: How to calculate the contact force?
items.body:
Hi, by checking mujoco documentation, I found that it supports a function mj_contactForce() to directly output the 6D contact force. 
And with your API mujoco_py.MjSim I can access the mujoco's mjModel and mjData variables. However, it seems that they do not directly contain the force information.
In my understanding, I calculate the contact force in this way:

```python
for i in range(mjData.ncon):
    print(' Contact force on geom2', mjData.cfrc_ext[mjModel.geom_bodyid[mjData.contact[i].geom2]])
```
But I am not sure if this calculation is right. I mainly try to first locate the body of the collision geom, and extract the external force on that body. Do I need some more calculation on it?

Thanks in advance!

items.title: Adding deformable objects to model
items.body:
I trying to add a deformable object(eg. cloth) to mujoco model, using the documentation under 'composite ' element in mujoco modelling (http://mujoco.org/book/modeling.html). Following is my xml right now 

```
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<mujoco>
	 <compiler inertiafromgeom='auto' coordinate="global" />

	<worldbody>
     	<light diffuse=".5 .5 .5" pos="0 0 3" dir="0 0 -1"/>  
      	<camera name="camera1" pos="0 0 0.25" />
        	<body>
        	<composite type="grid" count="9 9 1" spacing="0.05" offset="0 0 1">
        		<skin material="matcarpet" inflate="0.001" subgrid="3" texcoord="true"/>
        		<geom size=".02"/>
        		<pin coord="0 0"/>
        		<pin coord="8 0"/>
    		</composite>
    		<body>
   </worldbody>

</mujoco> 
```

On doing `load_model_from_path(xml_path)` I get the following error :

> 
`mj_loadXML error: b"XML Error: Schema violation: unrecognized element\n\nElement 'composite', line 9, column 13\n"`

Does mujoco-py support deformable objects yet ?

items.title: Segmentation fault on rendering threads
items.body:
I've been trying to use mujoco-py to implement an A3C algorithm for my robotics project. I've been using threading to run multiple instances of the simulation kept in a list, where each element is a separate simulation.


```
envs = []
for _ in range(num_threads):
        envs.append(MJenv(sim_path, skip_actions=4, cam_fps=30, game_time=(20*60), num_frames=4, w=320, h=240))

processes = []
for i in range(num_threads):
            processes.append(threading.Thread(target=async_trainer, args=(agent,
            envs[i], sess, i, T_queue, saver, save_path,) ) )
```
However, when a second thread tries to use `sim.render`, within it's own environment, I get a `Segmentation fault (core dumped)` error. I believe it has something to do with the rendering buffer in mujoco-py, but I'm not sure how to solve it even if it is. If anyone could help me even through an example of how to use multiprocessing or threading with mujoco-py I'd me incredibly grateful.

Thank you in advance.

PS: I'm not using `gym` I've created my own class `MJenv` which imports mujoco_py. Could that be an issue?

gdb OUTPUT
```
Thread 26 "python" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
[Switching to Thread 0x7fff763fe700 (LWP 6014)]
0x00007fffcde36fe4 in ?? () from /usr/lib/nvidia-390/libGLdispatch.so.0
(gdb) where
```

items.title: Meaning of the observation list
items.body:
Hi, 
Is there a way of knowing the "meaning" of the elements from the observation list ? There is good documentation for the basic environments : 
[https://github.com/openai/gym/wiki/CartPole-v0](url)
But I can't find something similar for the mujocos envs. Thank you very much.

        raise CompileError(msg)
    distutils.errors.CompileError: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1

I went into the mentioned file `[home]/python/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mujoco_py-1.50.1.56-py3.6.egg/mujoco_py/gl/eglshim.c` and changed the for loop signature in line 159 from

    for (int device_id=0; device_id<MAX_DEVICES; device_id++) {

to 

    int device_id = 0;
    for (device_id=0; device_id<MAX_DEVICES; device_id++) {

Now I am able to import mujoco_py. I would suggest setting the c99 flag or changing the loop signature.

On a side note, I tried the example from the readme file, but the file `/xmls/claw.xml` does not exist. (It is looking in `[home]/python/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mujoco_py-1.50.1.56-py3.6.egg/`, but there is no directory `/xmls`.) But this is probably another issue.

items.title: Speeding up Rendering
items.body:
Is there a good way to render MuJoCo images (i.e an image of the environment) fast / What's the fastest way to render?

I am trying to get a speed up in rendering (goal is to collect more data) by spawning multiple environments, but when I test a single environment worker and multiple environment workers, I see a performance decrease in speed.

```python

import time
st = time.time()
env = gym.make(env_id)
env.reset()
for i in range(3000):
    action = env.action_space.sample()
    obs, rewards, dones, info = env.step(action)
    env.render(mode='rgb_array')
    if dones:
        env.reset()

print(time.time() - st)
```

Gives me about 15s to render 3000 frames, where as an MPI enabled version, (3 MPI workers, using `SubprocVecEnv`) is taking longer (~24s to render the same 3000 frames).

Is there any way I can boost the speed at which frames get rendered?

items.title: Reading joint limits from model
items.body:
Hi all,

I am trying to normalise my environment observations, which is linked to the joint space of the robot.

My robot has it's joints' limits specified within the XML i.e. 
` <joint name="XX_joint" type="slide" pos="0 0 0" axis="0 0 1" limited="true" range="0 0.31"/> ` and being read with `mujoco_py.load_model_from_path(MODEL_PATH)`.


I have tried accessing any of the properties that may include `joint` or `range`, `limit` within their name defined in [the mujoco wrapper](https://github.com/openai/mujoco-py/blob/cd247d5fae39f21e913104350e26ac7254fa4b93/mujoco_py/generated/wrappers.pxi#L1150).

Alas, I have not succeeded in extracting the range of the joints. 
However, `model.joint_names` does return the correct list of names.

Does anyone has any better idea than manually parsing the XML?

Thanks,
Daniel

items.title: Segmentation fault when creating window glfw
items.body:
When I run `python -c "import gym; env = gym.make('Humanoid-v2'); env.render()"` with mujoco 1.50, it shows the following error:
```
Creating window glfw
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

I use gdb to debug this and get the following messages:
```
Creating window glfw

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007fffefd4228e in glGetString () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libOSMesa.so.6
```

However, it does works well when I try ./simulate in the ./mujoco/mjpro150/bin
Does anyone know how to fix this issue? I have Ubuntu 14.04, python 3.5.2 and have updated the latest OpenGL library.
